text: <@U2H61EJSG> heads up on that tap target build -  Natalie is saying after install the trend never comes up. Can you take look when you're in?
<@U1S5GKTHQ> <@U3ZFEAPSP> looks like trends is down - not sure whats going on here but the terms arent even being pulled in / nothing appearing on screen
:rotating_light::rotating_light::rotating_light:
weird, it just corrected itself - but sharing BR adam sent. can we understand why this happened?
<@U13GPDA1F|lynsey> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/lynsey/F4WCPEZ8R/bugreport-n2g47e-2017-04-10-11-50-29.zip|bugreport-N2G47E-2017-04-10-11-50-29.zip>

<@U13GPDA1F> in meetings all day unfortunately, but noticed that 3pr google cloud project spun up a new instance at 11:26am (EST) today. That project is configured to auto-scale. Wondering if that had something to do with this. Will dig more into it when I have some breathing room. As long as it’s up right now, shouldn’t be urgent but def. worth tracking down what happened.

<@U1S5GKTHQ|dimitry> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/dimitry/F4X4NR65A/pasted_image_at_2017_04_10_12_27_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-04-10, 12:27 PM> and commented: looks like a spike in usage caused the system to spin up a second instance. probably related, but shouldn't be crashing the system.

initial_comment.comment: looks like a spike in usage caused the system to spin up a second instance. probably related, but shouldn't be crashing the system.

text: thanks so much <@U1S5GKTHQ> sorry to drag you back in but this is super helpful

<@U13GPDA1F> Without really understanding how App Engine works, here is the best summary I can come up with to explain the Trends issue this morning: There was a significant spike in traffic this morning coinciding with the time Natalie reported the problem (approx 8:30 AM). The App Engine runs on ‘instances’  and I’m assuming there is a limit to the amount of traffic a single instance of the App Engine is able to receive so when it exceeded that limit, App Engine kicked off a new instance. According to a stack overflow post, the process of kicking off a new instance can take around 30 minutes which would explain why Trends started working again starting shortly after 9AM. <@U1S5GKTHQ> - does that sound at all like a probable cause for this issue?

hmmm thats makes sense to me. i wonder if there is a way to safeguard against the downtime associated with it - maybe just increase the number of instances we have going? im prob oversimplifying:upside_down_face:

<@U2H61EJSG>: very good summary. i’m not super sure on 30 min spin-up time. generally instances for Python deploys spin up very very fast (we’re talking <1 min fully deployed). also the new instance is showing only 1 request. other instance is at 38108 requests and counting. very bizarre.
<@U13GPDA1F>: not oversimplifying. was thinking something along those lines too. two beefy instances at all times. will dig into project App Engine config. to see what’s provisioned right now.
thanks again <@U1S5GKTHQ> - whenever you have time now that we’re beyond the danger zone :pray:

<!here> question from Adam: When a user opens the app the 1st time, do we know what device they have? 

Its a question that came up in the context of how to we handle legacy users and can we freeze the current onboarding design for legacy users (Nexus and 1st gen pixel owners).
That's assuming that Nexus and first gen pixel owners won't buy new cases?
Ideally onboarding would be generic/global up through pairing... Then we can get more specific on content/interaction pattern once the case is identified
I can send back the response, we can definitely determine what device the user is on and change which Onboarding Activity they go through.

are we logging the image being displayed / downloaded? in case it harfs in the middle of the night? :slightly_smiling_face:

if you crash
